page.title: 14 Farming in Strelley
page.content: A farmer in Strelley says: "Farming has changed greatly. In the old days you could make a living with 8 or 10 cows but now you have to keep a large herd. I have 150 dairy cows, plus some beef cattle and a few sheep. We grow wheat, barley, oats and potatoes _ just as we used to do. But now there are different varieties. For instance, the wheat used to have very long straw, for when we cut with a binder. Now we want wheat with short straw to avoid overloading the combine harvester. We use a lot of fertilisers now such as mixtures of potash, phosphate and nitrogen. We also use cow manure and slurry and on the arable land we use a lot of Severn-Trent slurry and sludge. It's very good for opencast and heather land. But people round about don't like it - because of the smell!"
